translation.text: Delays continue to some services following urgent signal equipment repairs caused by extreme weather conditions at Parramatta earlier. Some train stopping patterns and departure platforms may continue to change at short notice. Please listen to announcements, check indicator boards, and monitor Transport apps for updates.

Delays continue to services from the City due to a train requiring mechanical repairs at Central earlier, and urgent signal equipment repairs between Kingswood and Penrith. We are working hard to return services to normal, and as a result some train stopping patterns and departure platforms may change at short notice. Please listen to announcements, check indicator boards, and monitor Transport apps for updates.

Buses continue to replace trains between Mount Victoria and Bathurst due to infrastructure damage caused by bushfires; please allow additional travel time.

Buses replacing trains between Mt Victoria, Lithgow and Bathurst in both directions due to infrastructure damage caused by bushfires. 

Following 4 services will run as per timetable:
3:42am Lithgow to Bathurst
5:46am Bathurst to Central
5:47pm Central to Bathurst
10:17pm Bathurst to Lithgow

There is no forecast when the line can reopen. Please allow additional travel time and check transport apps for further details.
Central Coast & Newcastle Line - Partial Closure

Trains are currently suspended between Gosford and Hornsby in both directions due to a tree in the overhead wiring at Woy Woy 
Buses are in operation between Gosford and Hornsby in both directions. Customers are advised to allow extra travel time or delay their travel until services can resume on the Central Coast Line. The timeframe for trains to resume isn't yet known and we anticipate that this will cause delays and alterations to normal timetabled services for an extended period.
Please listen for updates from our train crew, station staff and other announcements. We will continue to update through the afternoon with further details about changes to train services.
Buses are unable to stop at Hawkesbury River due to narrow roads leading into the entrance of the station. Customers are advised to change at Berowra or Hornsby to complete their journey
Special Events - Twilight at Taronga 2020 Summer Concert Series, 31 January to 7 March

From Friday 31 January to Saturday 7 March on Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday nights only.
6:00 pm - 9:30 pm

From Circular Quay, catch a ferry to Taronga Zoo wharf.
From North Sydney, change for a bus to Spit Junction in Mosman to catch connecting 247 change for another bus direct to the Zoo entrance.
From Wynyard, change for a route 247 or M30 bus direct to the Zoo or a frequent B-Line or Military Road bus service from Carrington St to Spit Junction to connect with buses to the Zoo entrance.

Sydney 7's - Bankwest Stadium, Bankwest
09:30 to 20:55
- The closest station to Bankwest Stadium is Parramatta. The stadium is approximately 15minutes walk from the station
- Trains run every 10 to 15 minutes to Parramatta in both directions

Stakes Day - Royal Randwick Racecourse, Randwick
12:55 to 17:50
- The closest station to Royal Randwick Racecourse is Central. Change for a light rail service to Royal Randwick leaving from Chalmers Street every 10 to 15 minutes.

A-League: Newcastle Jets v Western United - McDonald Jones Stadium, Broadmeadow
17:00 to 19:00
- The closest station to McDonald Jones Stadium is Broadmeadow on the Central Coast & Newcastle Line. The stadium is approximately a 15-20 minute (1.5km) walk from the station
Be heat smart and stay hydrated. If you feel unwell, don't risk boarding a train. Station staff can assist you

The lift between the concourse and Platforms 3, 5, and 6 is temporarily out of service.  If you require assistance, please ask staff or phone 8878 4100.
The lift between the concourse and platform 1 is temporarily out of service. If you require assistance, please ask staff or phone 9563 7440.
The lift between the concourse and Addison Street is temporarily out of service.
The lift between the concourse and platform is temporarily out of service. For assistance ask staff or call 9851 7243.
The lift between the footbridge and platforms 1/2 is temporarily out of service. For assistance ask station staff or call 4739 1620

The public toilets at Beverly Hills station are currently unavailable while major repairs take place. Temporary toilets have been provided and are located outside the station on Tooronga Terrace. These facilities can be accessed during staffed hours. We apologise for any inconvenience.

Due to station maintenance works, the pedestrian ramp between Richmond Platform 2 and the concourse is closed. If you are unable to use the stairs, a shuttle bus to and from East Richmond station will be available.   For further assistance, please see station staff or call 9851 7248.

The public toilets at St James Station are closed while major works are taking place. Public toilets are located at the Elizabeth Street entrance to the right and in Hyde Park through the Macquarie Street tunnel up the stairs to the right. We apologise for any inconvenience.

New Metro Platforms are being constructed on platforms 1 & 2 at Sydenham Station. T3 Bankstown Line services to the City operate from platform 3 & T3 Bankstown Line services to Lidcombe and Liverpool operate from platform 4. Platform 4, 5 & 6 upgrade works - A new Metro concourse is also being constructed at the Northern end of the station. While the concourse is being installed, please board and alight from the first 5 carriages of the train on platforms 4 & 6 and the last 6 carriages of the train on platform 5. If you need help, please see staff at the station. For more information on these upgrades, please see sydneymetro.info
